.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task BackupAsync(valuetype Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupDescription backupDescription, valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The cancellation token is used to monitor for cancellation requests.
Docs.summary: Performs a backup of all reliable state managed by this .
Docs.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
Docs.remarks: Boolean returned by the backupCallback indicate whether the service was able to successfully move the backup folder to an external location. If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

Docs.summary:
Override this method to supply the communication listeners for the service replica. The endpoints returned by the communication listener are stored as a JSON string of ListenerName, Endpoint string pairs like {"Endpoints":{"Listener1":"Endpoint1","Listener2":"Endpoint2" ...}}
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle

Protected Overridable Sub OnAbort ()

Docs.summary:
The notification that the service is being aborted. RunAsync MAY be running concurrently with the execution of this method, as cancellation is not awaited on the abort path.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle

This method is called when role of the replica is changing and it is the final step before completing . Override this method to be notified that ChangeRole has completed for this replica's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle

This method is called as the final step of closing the service gracefully. Override this method to be notified that Close has completed for this replica's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
Docs.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

Docs.param: A to be used to restore the service.
Docs.summary: This method is called during suspected data loss. You can override this method to restore the service in case of data loss.
Docs.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous restore operation. True indicates that the state has been restored. False indicates that the replica's state has not been modified.

Docs.summary: This method is called when replica's state has been restored successfully via the Backup Restore service. This is only supported when the reliable state provider replica object passed in the constructor is derived from .
Docs.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task RunAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task RunAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
abstract member RunAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task override this.RunAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Docs.summary:
This method is implemented as a processing loop and will only be called when the replica is primary with write status. Override this method with the application logic.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
Docs.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.
Docs.remarks:
Please ensure you follow these guidelines when overriding :
Make sure passed to is honored and once it has been signaled, exits gracefully as soon as possible. Please note that if has finished its intended work, it does not need to wait for to be signaled and can return gracefully.
Service Fabric runtime does not handle all exception(s) escaping from . If an unhandled exception escapes from , then Service Fabric runtime takes following action(s):
If a (or one of its derived exception) escapes from , Service Fabric runtime will restart this service replica. A health warning will be appear in Service Fabric Explorer containing details about unhandled exception.
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has requested cancellation by signaling passed to , Service Fabric runtime handles this exception and considers it as graceful completion of .
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has NOT requested cancellation by signaling passed to , the process that is hosting this service replica is brought down. This will impact all other service replicas that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
If an exception of any other type escapes from then the process that is hosting this service replica is brought down. This will impact all other service replicas that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
Failing to conform to these guidelines can cause fail-over, reconfiguration or upgrade of your service to get stuck and can impact availability of your service.
